name: Waltz of the Wizard
description: Waltz of the Wizard is a virtual reality experience that lets you feel what it’s like to have magical powers. Combine arcane ingredients into a boiling cauldron with the help of an ancient spirit trapped in a human skull. Unleash creative or destructive wizardry upon a fully interactive virtual world.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 (64-bit) Processor: Intel i5-4590 / AMD FX 8350 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 / AMD Radeon R9 290 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10 (64-bit) Processor: Intel i7-4790 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 5 GB available space

reviews.review_text: My review, like the game, will be in rhyme. This game is great, I would say it is sublime. Although, I do feel like it is a crime, to have so much fun, and yet not pay a dime!
Fun little tech demo, I very much enjoyed it.. and im sure you will too.
Great experience, I want an arena with fireballs plz :)
Should cost money

This by far would have to be one of the most immersive experiences I have had in VR. The aim of this game is to use the various ingredients at your disposal to brew magical potions. Each potion will give you a power you can unleash with the controller. The talking skull was a great touch. I just wish there was more to do in this game. For a free download there is absolutley no reason you should not.
Best free Vr game out there!
Great VR Experience! A must try! A+
Awsome experience. Really well done.
Absolutely stunning in every way! This is what VR should be all about.
Very short but fun VR run. I got the vive just for this and it was worth it and I do wonder if I found everything or if there are secrets hidding in other places I didn't notice.
Short but fun. And free. So give it a go!

How is this free?! Some of the best graphics and physics i've seen so far in VR. That bit when you're high up on a dodgy rope bridge really made my stomach drop, the feeling that you are really that high up and could fall to your death is pretty amazing.
the name of the game should be 'Waltz Of A Disorder-Seizure Patient Who Always Swings His Arms Like A R*tard'
short but very enjoable game and hope for more like this
A fun little distraction in VR. Much better than I expected. I think this team has the real chance to stich these ideas into a coherent game!

You'd think this has not much to offer, but boy is it fun. Had moments leaving me mesmerized, watching myself throw stuff arround like i'm ♥♥♥♥♥♥ yoda using the force. Very immersive experience that you'll remember, lots of love for detail.

Fun for a few minutes. Graphics are great and what is there is good quality, but there isn't much of it. You stand behind a table and toss various combinations of the 3 sets of 2 ingredients into the cauldron and discover spells that way. Beyond that there are a few random items on the table to play around with (crossbow, skull, xylophone).   You will probably enjoy it for about 10-15 minutes then get bored after doing everything there is to do.

Overall: Its a good experience. I am a fan of how the game does a lot of things. A lot of fun bits and bobs to poke and play with. I feel like I've figured out the vast majority of what the experience has to offer in a short period of time. I do reccomend trying this at least once and using it as an introduction to VR when friends are over.  How it runs: It has some slight lag on my rig but I'm not surprised. Nothing that kept me from having fun or made me feel ill.  Rig: OS - Windows 10 Professional (x64) CPU - 3.40 gigahertz Intel Core i5-3570K GPU - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 950 RAM - 8GB DDR3 MOBO - ASUSTeK P8Z77-V LK
